Legal_Issue: RAD's review of RPD's Religion and Exit Findings, jurisdiction over Sur Place Claim
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility issues led to claim dismissal
Basis_of_Claim: Religion, risk on return, sur place membership
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility, proper standard of review, jurisdiction
Decision_Maker: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Application_Error: RAD applied reasonableness instead of correctness to religion finding
Review_Outcome: RAD decision set aside in part
Assessment_Standard: Correctness for legal questions, reasonableness for factual findings
Legal_Standard: Standard of review: correctness vs. reasonableness
Application_Factor: Existence of prior RPD decision on sur place claim
Decision_Outcome: Remanded for reconsideration of Religion Finding; Sur Place Claim referred to RPD
Decision_Review_Issue: Jurisdiction of RAD, standard of review
Standard_of_Review: Correctness for jurisdiction and legal interpretation, reasonableness for factual assessments
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Federal Court reviews RAD decisions with correctness on law, reasonableness on facts
Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility issues, lack of jurisdiction on sur place claim
Procedural_Fairness: RAD must not decide issues outside its jurisdiction
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RAD's standard of review and jurisdiction
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada, Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter considerations
Procedural_Issue: Improper assumption of jurisdiction by RAD over undeclared sur place claim
Omission_Type: Failure to refer new issue to RPD
